ngiemboon: Anò la pú te poŋo Yenésè na mmó gie Ssé ka gÿo wɔ́. Tà á kwaʼ ńgyáŋa lóŋ.
en: Jonah was greatly displeased and became furious.

ngiemboon: Ésẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, yɛ̂ té mmó ya gie n da gɔɔn fʉ̀ʼ gie n da nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ láʼ peg wɔ́ le? Áa mmó gie á la gÿo, e faʼa légwóon ńkÿo ńgʉa né Taasísè. N da ne ńzsé ngie ɔɔ Ssé gie e gẅiin pòŋontʉ́m, ńgẅiin tsɔ́ɔnmezìŋe, ńgẅiin kwɔ̀gɔnnɛ́, ńgẅiin máamáa nkwòŋe, ńtyé pɔ́ lényé ngɔ́ʼ gie ɔ̀ kɔʼɔ́ ńgee ńzába twó pʉ̀a.
en: He prayed to the Lord,   “Please, Lord, isn’t this what I said while I was still in my own country? That’s why I fled toward Tarshish in the first place.  # 4:2 Jnh 1:3 I knew that you are a gracious and compassionate God,  # 4:2 Ex 34:6; Nm 14:18; Ps 86:5,15; Jl 2:13 slow to anger, abounding in faithful love, and one who relents from sending disaster.  # 4:2 Neh 9:17

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a nyé wɔ́ɔn, n kwé, áa mbòŋ mbwó mèŋ lékwé ńcʉa legwɔ́ wó!»
en: And now, Lord, take my life from me,   for it is better for me to die than to live.”  # 4:3 Jb 7:15–16; Ec 7:1

ngiemboon: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ gyáŋa lóŋ pɛ́ʼɛ̀, á gwɔ́ mbòŋ?»
en: The Lord asked, “Is it right for you to be angry? ”

ngiemboon: Yenésè fó tÿǒsoŋo Ninive ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa né shÿó sǎʼnèm, ńkúu jʉʼó ńnÿɔgɔ yáŋ, ńdɔg ńgÿo múɔ méntàb, lélɔg ńkʉŋe nèm. Ńne ńzẅíʼte mmó gie á ge cʉa tÿǒsoŋ.
en: Jonah left the city and found a place east of it.   He made himself a shelter there and sat in its shade to see what would happen to the city.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé cʉ́ʼʉ lépʉ́le lóŋ Yenésè, ńgÿo atÿǒ leshʉŋ sáʼ, ńgúʼ tà jʉ́jʉ́ŋ wɛ̌ kábte yé. Anò yɛ̌ pú ḿboŋo Yenésè.
en: Then the Lord God appointed a plant, and it grew over Jonah to provide shade for his head to rescue him from his trouble.   Jonah was greatly pleased with the plant.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, e Ssé mʉ́ pɔ́ mbaʼámbaʼ, ńtúmo tsɔ́ cʉ̀cÿɔ̀gɔ, á tó ḿpfɛ́ɛ tÿǒ leshʉŋ ya, á júm.
en: When dawn came the next day, God appointed a worm that attacked the plant, and it withered.

ngiemboon: Nèm gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńkẅɛ, e Ssé gÿo tsɔ̌ fèfà gẅie à tween tween, á fó shÿó sǎʼnèm ńtó. Nèm cúɔ ndù Yenésè tà á gwe. Ńtsɔ́ɔn legwé ńgɔɔn ngie: «Áa mbòŋ mbwó mèŋ lékwé ńcʉa legwɔ́ wó!»
en: As the sun was rising, God appointed a scorching east wind.   The sun beat down on Jonah’s head  # 4:8 Ps 121:6; Is 49:10 so much that he almost fainted, and he wanted to die. He said, “It’s better for me to die than to live.”  # 4:8 Jnh 4:3

ngiemboon: E Ssé zɛ́te Yenésè ngie: «Ɔ̀ gyáŋa lóŋ ńtí yɔɔn tÿǒ leshʉŋ páʼɔɔn, á gwɔ́ jʉʼó ńgwɔ́ púʼu?» Yenésè tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Oon, n gyáŋa lóŋ tà ńtsɔ́ɔn mbɔɔ lékwé, á gwɔ́ jʉʼó, ńgwɔ́ púʼu!»
en: Then God asked Jonah, “Is it right for you to be angry about the plant? ”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gíŋe ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Júʼu, yɔɔn tÿǒ leshʉŋ kaa náa tsɔ́ faʼ mbwó gù wɔ́, gù zɔ ka te gÿo á sáʼ wɔ́. Á ka lɔg pɔ́ tàʼ letsẅɛ́ʼ ńgúʼ, letsẅɛ́ʼ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a gwɔ́, á júm, ɔ̀ pǐŋ ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mé la.
en: And the Lord said, “You cared about the plant, which you did not labor over and did not grow. It appeared in a night and perished in a night.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ pǐŋ ńkwaŋ jú ngie ngwɔ́ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, ń de tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe máa tÿǒsoŋo Ninive wɔ́ la? Á jʉʼ gie pʉ̀a ée wó tà ńtɔ́g pʉ̀a ntsáʼ móm mbʉ́a nzèm nkÿo, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é té nò mbòŋo zsé, ńké te yetepòŋ zsé. Anùɔ menɔ̀ɔn tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gíŋ ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ ayɛ̌.»
en: So may I not care about the great city of Nineveh,   which has more than a hundred twenty thousand people who cannot distinguish between their right and their left,  # 4:11 Dt 1:39; Is 7:16 as well as many animals? ”  # 4:11 Ps 36:6
